tool.name: SAGA.imagery_vigra.11
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayTABLE False isArrayFEATURES False isArrayPREDICTION False isArrayTRAINING False isArrayRF_IMPORT False isArrayRF_EXPORT False output_data_IMPORTANCES $output_data_IMPORTANCES name SAGA.imagery_vigra.11 TABLE $TABLE FEATURES $FEATURES PREDICTION $PREDICTION TRAINING $TRAINING LABEL_AS_ID $LABEL_AS_ID RF_IMPORT $RF_IMPORT RF_EXPORT $RF_EXPORT RF_TREE_COUNT $RF_TREE_COUNT RF_TREE_SAMPLES $RF_TREE_SAMPLES RF_REPLACE $RF_REPLACE RF_SPLIT_MIN_SIZE $RF_SPLIT_MIN_SIZE RF_NODE_FEATURES $RF_NODE_FEATURES RF_STRATIFICATION $RF_STRATIFICATION prefer $prefer response $response outputType_IMPORTANCES $OutputSection_IMPORTANCES.outputType_IMPORTANCES transmissionMode_IMPORTANCES $OutputSection_IMPORTANCES.transmissionMode_IMPORTANCES

param.name: TABLE
param.label: Table
param.help: Table with features, must include class-ID The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FEATURES
param.label: Features
param.help: Select features (table fields) for classification The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: PREDICTION
param.label: Prediction
param.help: This is field that will have the prediction results. If not set it will be added to the table. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: TRAINING
param.label: Training
param.help: this is the table field that defines the training classes The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: LABEL_AS_ID
param.label: Use Label as Identifier
param.help: Use training area labels as identifier in classification result, assumes all label values are integer numbers!

param.name: RF_IMPORT
param.label: Import from File
param.help: Import from File The following data types are allowed in the txt file: plain

param.name: RF_EXPORT
param.label: Export to File
param.help: Export to File The following data types are allowed in the txt file: plain

param.name: RF_TREE_SAMPLES
param.label: Samples per Tree
param.help: Specifies the fraction of the total number of samples used per tree for learning.

param.name: RF_REPLACE
param.label: Sample with Replacement
param.help: Sample from training population with or without replacement?

param.name: RF_SPLIT_MIN_SIZE
param.label: Minimum Node Split Size
param.help: Number of examples required for a node to be split. Choose 1 for complete growing.

param.name: RF_STRATIFICATION
param.label: Stratification
param.help: Specifies stratification strategy. Either none, equal amount of class samples, or proportional to fraction of class samples.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_IMPORTANCES
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value
